intro: Sesamum celebicum, commonly known as the Celebes sesame, is a flowering plant native to Indonesia. It belongs to the family Pedaliaceae and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows in tropical climates and is often found in moist, well-drained soils. Its seeds are used in traditional medicine and as a source of oil. The botanical features of Sesamum celebicum make it an important species in both ecological and agricultural contexts.
